intro: Cynoglossum reuteri, commonly known as the narrowleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cynoglossum reuteri is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
